newsitem.title: UK: Cellnet connects over 1 mln digital customers.
newsitem.headline: Cellnet connects over 1 mln digital customers.

text.p: Cellnet, the British mobile telephone operator 60-percent owned by British Telecommunications Plc, said on Thursday it had connected more than one million customers to its digital phones.
An unprecedented surge in demand for the service, which was launched in July 1994, had beated expectations, the company added in a statement.

"Growth for Cellnet's digital service is well ahead of forecasts," said Cellnet's managing director Howard Ford. "Over a third of a million customers have opted for digital in the last six months alone..."
Once more competitive and "substantially" lower digital tariffs take effect from March 1, 1997, the company expects sales for its older analogue service to "virtually cease", it said.

Customers choosing Cellnet's Occasional Caller Plus service will save up to 20 percent compared with the nearest analogue tariff -- Occasional Caller -- based on 20 minutes of calls per month, Cellnet said.
The company, which is 40-percent owned by Securicor Group plc, had a total customer base of 2.68 million customers at the end of 1996.
